title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall in Fenway, celebrating 20 years since his debut album Get Lifted.
Legend's setlist included hits like 'All Of Me' and covered songs by artists such as Kanye West and Alicia Keys.
Legend's performance included storytelling and audience engagement, highlighting his varied musical influences and career journey.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, hinting at biased calls.
After the Celtics' loss to the Jazz, Brown explicitly blamed the refs for a missed foul call on him.
Brown scored 32 points against the Magic but struggled in the fourth, attributing it to missed opportunities.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Baker Mayfield leads Tampa Bay as an MVP candidate with 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and two interceptions this season.
Injuries challenge Buccaneers' offense with top receivers Chris Godwin and Mike Evans out against the Patriots.
Buccaneers' defense shines with strong performances from Vita Vea, Jamel Dean, and Antoine Winfield Jr. this season.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo to call Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS, their first Patriots game since 2023.
Nantz and Romo last called a Patriots game during a Week 6, 2023 loss to the Raiders.
The broadcast indicates Patriots' renewed NFL relevance with quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel leading.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics fall to Magic 123-110 in NBA Cup, despite Jaylen Brown's 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting.
Celtics struggle defensively, allowing 38 and 39 points in the first and fourth quarters respectively.
Payton Pritchard finds shooting form, scoring 27 points, including 5-for-8 from 3-point range, in loss to Magic.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating 'appearance of impropriety' in 2018 ICE incident.
Hearing officer Denis J. McInerney found Judge Joseph unaware of any escape plan and cleared her of misconduct.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022; she agreed to state misconduct investigation leading to reprimand.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future after playoff loss to Yankees in AL Wild Card.
Trevor Story opted in while Alex Bregman opted out of their contracts as MLB offseason activities commence.
Cora reflects on 2025 season, highlighting player contributions and expressing hope for improved performance in 2026.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A wind turbine blade detached near Head of the Bay Road in Plymouth, landing in a cranberry bog.
The 75 to 100-foot blade broke from a 300-foot turbine with no reported injuries or public danger.
The site was secured by officials, and the incident is under investigation by MassDEP and Inspectional Services.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' streams on Disney+, featuring Pedro Pascal as Mr. Fantastic in a new MCU film.
'Frankenstein,' directed by Guillermo del Toro and starring Oscar Isaac, is now streaming on Netflix.
'Squid Game: The Challenge' Season 2 is available on Netflix with Malden resident Eric Eldridge as a contestant.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs, in his 11th NFL season, seeks to improve his attitude and manage perfectionist tendencies.
Diggs leads the Patriots with 508 receiving yards, 45 receptions, and 56.4 yards per game this season.
Diggs praises offensive coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing for fostering a supportive and growth-oriented environment.
